subject: Nutrition
title: The Birth of Breakfast Cereal
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Birth of Breakfast Cereal usable.

hook.text: Cornflakes were invented by a health crusader as a bland food to suppress physical urges.

buildup.text: John Harvey Kellogg ran a sanitarium promoting vegetarian diets, exercise, and bland grain-based foods.

discovery.text: His brother Will added sugar to make cereal palatable, creating the modern breakfast cereal industry.

twist.text: Cereal companies then invented the myth that breakfast is essentialâ€”to sell more product.

climax.text: Today, many breakfast cereals contain more sugar per serving than a chocolate chip cookie.

punchline.text: A health crusade became a sugar delivery system.
